answers: India covers an area of about 3.287 million square kilometres.
It is the 7th largest country in the world by land area.
The capital of India is New Delhi.
It serves as the seat of the government.
Uttar Pradesh has a population of over 240 million people.
It is the most populous state in India.
The Ganga is the longest and most sacred river of India.
It originates from the Gangotri Glacier in the Himalayas.
The national animal of India is the Bengal Tiger.
India's climate is dominated by the monsoon, with distinct wet and dry seasons.
The Thar Desert, also known as the Great Indian Desert, is a large arid region in the northwestern part of the Indian subcontinent.
